results.title: Colour today
results.brief_description: An account of the properties of colors and their use in decoration, advertising and other spheres of everyday life. Functional use of color in office, factory, and domestic equipment is discussed, and sequences show how color and design combined bring attractiveness to manufactured goods including bicycles, sewing machines and typewriters.

results.title: Colour of war [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Carlton Television, Transworld International, Lucy Carter and Alastair Laurence
results.brief_description:
Almost all our recollections of the Second World War are in black and white. But years of research have unearthed hours of previously unseen colour film offering a completely new portrait of the war. The result is ‘Colour Of War’ a remarkable insight into the event that has shaped our modern world. Dramatic colour footage from as early as 1933 shows home movies of Adolf Hitler and his co-horts, the devastation wrought by the Blitz, life on the home front, D-Day and the Allied Invasion of France, British bombers defying German fighters, the horror of the Holocaust that greeted troops as they entered Germany and the jubilation of VE Day. With John Thaw’s narration and spoken accounts from the letters and diaries of those who fought, those who survived, and those the war claimed as victims, this three part documentary is an extraordinary remembrance.
1. ‘A new world order’ Reccollections of those involved during the pre-war turmoil of 1930s when the rhetoric of ideology and extremism was increasingly being heard. Highlights include combat footage of the Spanish Civil War, the coronation of King George VI in 1937, spectacular mass rallies in Germany and the Soviet Union and the images of the devastation of the Blitz in Great Britain.
2. ‘Total War’ Focuses on the period when the war reached a new, global intensity, beginning with the bombing of Pearl Harbor in December 1941 and ending in the Summer of 1944 with US Marines fighting bloody battles with the Japanese in the Pacific.
3. ‘Triumph and despair’ The experiences of British, American and Canadian soldiers, who made the historic crossing of the Channel, and who fought through The Battle of the Hedgerows to liberate Northern France, are heard through their letters and diaries. The fears and emotions expressed by American, French and Japanese soldiers and Japanese and German civilians are accompanied by footage of the fall of Berlin, the Battle of Okinawa, Kamikaze attacks and the devastation of the Atom bomb. This volume concludes with footage of the release of POWs, refugees and displaced people and reflects on the legacy of a war which cost 50 million lives.

Also available on VHS [313552], [313553], and [313554].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carlton Television, Transworld International, Lucy Carter and Alastair Laurence

results.title: Colour in clay
results.brief_description: About pottery making in England. Shows the different methods used to form the pieces and ways in which they are decorated at a pottery works in England. Photographer: Jack Cardiff

results.description: Part of the Goodnight Kiwi series of direct addresses to the viewer specifically designed to be broadcast between the hours of 2-4am. Reflecting the often solitary and ritual nature of technological occupation, Goodnight Kiwi variously offers aesthetic transformation, mass media critique or moments of personal reflection arising from the effects of exhausted wakefulness.
description_for_label: Part of the Goodnight Kiwi series of direct addresses to the viewer specifically designed to be broadcast between the hours of 2-4am. Reflecting the often solitary and ritual nature of technological occupation, Goodnight Kiwi variously offers aesthetic transformation, mass media critique or moments of personal reflection arising from the effects of exhausted wakefulness.

results.title: Colour bars
results.creator_credit: Auburn Community Development Network, Mandy King and Fabio Cavadini
results.brief_description: This non-observational documentary made for SBS Independent is about the lives of five young Australians of non-English Speaking Backgrounds. They were born or raised in Australia and have experienced the ups and downs of growing up in at least two cultures; that of their parents and the mainstream culture.

results.title: Colour and the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
The theory of three colour photography had been known since the beginning of art but early methods were clumsy. Louis Lumiere devised a process in the late 1890’s which was not marketable and it was not until his autochromes became available in 1907 that colour photography was possible for everyone.

results.title: Colour
results.brief_description: A discussion of the nature of color in simple terms. Painting and dying are then shown as a way of preparing surfaces so as to reflect certain colors. Narrated by Joseph McLeod.

results.title: Colour
results.creator_credit: Color Film Center, Nico Crama and Christa van Santen
results.brief_description: Explores the use of colour in art and nature; discusses the concept of colour as the reflection and absorption of white light; explains the significance of hue, value, chroma, and complementary colours; and examines the illusions, emotional impact, and optical effects of colour. Animation: Ronald Raaijmakers. Commentary: Mart Ambry.
